result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel L Virgil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay restitution of $145, payable to Diane Helgerson within first 6 months of probation
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee
--To pay statutory court costs, fees, assessments, surcharges and DNA Surcharge as required by statute

--Mental Health Treatment
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination thereof, per Agent
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Mr. Virgil to 120 days in the Jefferson County Jail; with 103 days credit; the Court intends for this to be a time served sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:31pm [ma]
Defendant Daniel L Virgil in court, in custody with attorney Teri Strohschein.  Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 

The Court sentences Mr. Virgil to 120 days in the Jefferson County Jail; with 103 days credit; the Court intends for this to be a time served sentence.

recess: 1:39pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 9:29 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Daniel L Virgil in court with Attorney Luke Hudock. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hudock informs the Court that Mr. Virgil has some issues communicating and requests to use phone to type some answers, and Counsel will relay to Court.
No objection from ADA Hall; Court agrees this is acceptable method

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
ADA Hall submits victim restitution form

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--Mental Health Treatment
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination thereof, per Agent
--To pay statutory court costs, fees, assessments, surcharges and DNA Surcharge as required by statute
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay restitution of $145, payable to Diane Helgerson within first 6 months of probation
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 9:46 am
Proposed STAO for Continuance of 8/21/15 STC

Case called at 10:03am [mo]
Defendant Daniel L Virgil in court with Attorney Luke Hudock.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.

Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Diane Helgerson

recess: 10:07am 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/19/15 at 9:00am    (2)  Status Conference on 8/21/15 at 1:15pm
